Module chav1961.purelib
Package chav1961.purelib.streams

Class JsonSaxParser

java.lang.Object
chav1961.purelib.streams.JsonSaxParser
All Implemented Interfaces:
LineByLineProcessorCallback
public class JsonSaxParser
extends java.lang.Object
implements LineByLineProcessorCallback

This class implements a SAX-styled JSON parser to use in the in-stream JSON parsing application. Usage of this class is:

JsonSaxHandler handler = ...;
new JsonSaxParser(handler).parse(new InputStreamReader(...));

JSON format is according to RFC 7159

This class is specialized for fast JSON parsing, so it's native format in most of cases is a character arrays. To prevent performance degradation, avoid escaped strings in the input

This class is not thread-safe.

Performance notes:

  • environment: Intel Celeron 1.5GHz 2-core, 64, Windows 8. Windows performance index=3.2. Java SE 1.8-32.
  • testing set: 250 MB in-memory JSON(see test).

Performance result:

  • parsing speed ~50 MB/second

This class is not thread-safe, but all it's parsing methods are reusable

Since:
0.0.1
Author:
Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
See Also:
RFC 7159, JsonSaxHandler, JUnit tests

    • processLine

      public void processLine​(long displacement, int lineNo, char[] data, int from, int length) throws java.io.IOException
      Description copied from interface: LineByLineProcessorCallback

      Process line from the source character stream

      Specified by:
      processLine in interface LineByLineProcessorCallback
      Parameters:
      displacement - of the same first char from the beginning of the data stream
      lineNo - 1-based sequential line number in the data stream
      data - data stream to process. This data is in almost all cases a true source data, so you must not modify it to avoid unpredictable side effects in the caller methods
      from - starting position of the actual line in the data stream
      length - length of the actual line in the data stream
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - is any I/O errors were detected
